review_title: hooray! turn based RPGs work in VR
one_reviews_text:
This a good turn based rpg, with good characters, good english voice acting, classic dungeon crawling and fun puzzle.  After only 10 |I can tell there is plenty of player/skill/tool cusomization to scratch my 'give me choices' itch.  But what gives the most joy is that this game prove that my gaming comfort food [old school jrpg like] works in VR. 

Sadly there are a few UI choices that detract.  While I was able to enjoy this game with a little patience and practice, they could be show-stoppers to some.  I am hoping they will be addressed by the developers.

1.  Teloprtation is probably the right solution for this grid based game, but the choice of movement seem very off.  Make sure to glance at the map at your feet to determine which way the joystick will teleport you or your inner ear might complain.   Developers; please borrow the teleportation of BigScreen or the Oculus home.  

2. I initially complained about the game pad but discovered the touch conroler option in the settings :)

Edit: After the latest update I felt the need to change my review score to reflect this. After a few hours of playing I can say that controls are now responsive and the game itself is an actual joy to play. I love the old school esthetics incorporated into this game. If you were on the fence before I suggest giving this game a shot, especially after the update. You won't regret it, especially if you enjoy good old fashioned turn based Rpgs.
